text.__SUMMARY__: Mahonia gracilis is a plant species native to the Mexico, widely distributed from Tamaulipas to Oaxaca.Mahonia gracilis is a shrub. Leaves are pinnately compound with 4-7 pairs of leaflets plus a larger terminal leaflet, all lanceolate with teeth along the margins. Flowers are yellow 6-parted flowers, borne in an elongated raceme. Fruits are dark blue and egg-shaped.
text.External links: photo of herbarium specimen at Missouri Botanical Garden, Mahonia gracilis collected in Nuevo León, México
